page.title: 18LEOMINSTER BY-PASS
page.content: {Leominster}lies on the busy A49 trunk road which takes heavy traffic between the Manchester area and South Wales. The proposed by-pass is planned to pass to the east of{Leominster, starting near the level crossing to the north-east of the town. For most of its length it runs parallel with the railway and so avoids cutting farmers off from their fields. The road will be 7 metres wide and will be 7 kilometres long. It joins the A49 again at Cadbury's factory to the South of{Leominster. } It is estimated that the road will cost between 5 and 6 million pounds and will take about two years to build. Unfortunately{Leominster football team will lose their ground if it is built.
